servinfo.title: Rear Brake Drum and Shoe Inspection

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Rear Brake Drum Removal and Installation

servinfosub.title: Brake Drum
servinfosub.ptxt: If drum inner diameter is exceeds the limit or uneven or stepped wear is excessive, replace the drum.

topic.title: Cracked, scored, or grooved drum
topic.ptxt: A cracked, drum is unsafe for further service and must be replaced.
Do not attempt to weld a cracked drum.
Smooth up any slight scores. Heavy or extensive scoring will cause excessive brake lining wear and it will probably be necessary to resurface drum braking surface.
If brake linings are slightly worn and drum is grooved, drum should be polished with fine emery cloth but should no be turned.

attention3.ptxt: When drum is removed, visually inspect wheel cylinder for brake fluid leakage. Correct leaky point, if any.

servinfosub.title: Brake Shoe
servinfosub.ptxt: Measure the minimum thickness of brake lining (1). Also, check surface of lining for hardening, excessive wear and oil.

attention2.ptxt: Never polish lining with sandpaper. If lining is polished with sandpaper, hard particles of sandpaper will be deposited in lining and may damage drum. When it is required to correct lining, replace it with a new one.
